node.title: Johnson & Johnson loses bid to take pelvic mesh appeal to High Court
node.alt: A vaginal mesh implant on a table.
node.description: Pharmaceutical giant Johnson & Johnson has its bid for an appeal to a Federal Court ruling thrown out of the High Court.
node.content: ["Pharmaceutical giant Johnson & Johnson has had its bid for an appeal to\u00a0a Federal Court ruling thrown out of the High Court.", "Last year,\u00a0Johnson & Johnson and its subsidiaries\u00a0were ordered to pay $2.6 million in damages\u00a0to three women who had suffered serious side effects from faulty mesh implants.", "The women,\u00a0Kathryn Gill, Diane Dawson and Ann Sanders,\u00a0were the lead applicants in a class action of thousands of women who had experienced\u00a0side effects from the implants, including chronic pain and infection.", "The devices, also known as transvaginal mesh, were implanted into the pelvis for conditions that included pelvis organ prolapse and stress urinary incontinence.", "Earlier this year, the Federal Court found the Johnson & Johnson had been driven by commercial interests\u00a0and\u00a0there were no warnings about the side effects from the mesh implants.", "Today, the High Court denied the company's\u00a0leave application for a hearing, saying there was no\u00a0point of law in the case to be challenged and it would not have any prospect of success.", "More to come."]
